page.title: 17EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The two main employers in Marshfield are Ansell's Brewery and the Unigate Dairy. Most people travel to Cardiff or Newport to work.There is a village blacksmith but occupations such as thatcher, saddler and bootmaker have disappeared. Some occupations such as cattle hauler and agricultural builder are connected with the land but most of the people in our area are not employed on the land. They work in Hospitals, shops steelworks, factories, offices and public houses.Most Mothers work in the house, but some have part-time jobs in local pubs or shops.Unemployment is quite high in our area. Most men work 8 hours a day,except the farmers,who work up to 16 hours a day in the Summer.
